This version of Castlevania: Symphony of the Night (SotN) is based on the version of SotN included in The Dracula X Chronicles (DXC) on PSP. As such, it has the extra content from that version, NOT the extra content from the Saturn version. While the on-screen controls work well enough, I highly suggest that you use a controller, though the quality of your experience may vary. I'm using a Google Pixel 3a XL, and the game runs very well on it. Unfortunately, using an 8BitDo SN30 resulted in a significant amount of input lag. Switching to an 8BitDo Lite (which doesn't officially support Android, oddly) worked much better, though I have to pair the controller with my phone each time from scratch. As with the DXC version of SotN, this version has wildly inaccurate sound emulation at times, and it has the new voice acting and scenes from that version. Somehow, they've managed to make the pre-rendered video cutscenes of the castle look even worse in this version. Thankfully, this version does have some changes in the form of redesigned menus. While you may initially scoff at the idea of such a masterpiece having mobile-friendly menus, but it works surprisingly well, and it's nice to see a version of SotN with something resembling finished menus. Overall, I'd highly suggest picking this up, especially given its low price.

This is the best video game ever made, however, I prefer the original PS1 version's voice acting; the PlayStation Portable version (and now the Android version) totally ruined the game by rewriting the dialogue and changing all the voice actors. Konami should stop feeling embarrassed over the original dialogue and voice acting of SotN; it's a modern classic at this point, and we real SotN fans hate this botched up attempt at fixing something that never was broken to begin with. Plus I'd like to see an HD remake of SotN with beautiful 4K graphics, 5.1 lossless surround sound of the original soundtrack (with I am the Wind included at the end of the game) released on the PlayStation 4. If Capcom could give us well made Mega Man 1 and Mega Man X remakes on the PSP, I don't see why SotN should be excluded from the stellar treatment it deserves. I mean seriously now, how many times has Konami released a SotN port to a new platform whenever Konami needed some extra cash in these financially desperate times? Why not just release a beautiful 4K remake of SotN on the PS4? It would be a yuuuuge bestseller. Anyway aside from that, it'd be nice if Konami could bring back Koji Igarashi, Ayami Kojima and Michiru Yamane and let them do some old school Castlevania again.
